ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Noise-Induced Hearing Loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of significant unprotected firearms use; asymmetric configuration (right ear worse) is consistent with the acoustic shadow effect in a left-handed shooter.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Retrocochlear pathology
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Sudden exacerbation of tinnitus and aural pressure in the right ear, combined with asymmetry, warrants exclusion of retrocochlear etiology.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To determine hearing thresholds and configuration of hearing loss.
To assess speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities in quiet.
To assess the acoustic reflex arc and screen for retrocochlear pathology.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient presents with asymmetric high-frequency sensorineural hearing loss, significantly worse in the right ear, consistent with noise exposure from left-handed firearms use. Speech recognition in quiet is excellent bilaterally. Middle ear function is normal. The sudden change in right-sided tinnitus and pressure warrants medical referral.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Slight SNHL 250-2000 Hz, steeply sloping to severe loss 3-8 kHz with a profound notch at 6 kHz (PTA 17 dB HL). Left ear: Normal sensitivity 250-2000 Hz, steeply sloping to moderately-severe SNHL 3-8 kHz (PTA 12 dB HL).

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRTs (RE 17 dB HL, LE 12 dB HL) consistent with PTA. WRS excellent bilaterally (RE 96%, LE 92%).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Normal ipsilateral and contralateral thresholds 500-2000 Hz; absent at 4000 Hz. Reflex decay negative at 500 and 1000 Hz.

proposed_items: Continued use of hearing protection, with emphasis on custom earplugs
Annual hearing testing to monitor sensitivity
Evaluation with an audiologist to discuss HAT or amplification when ready
counseling_actions: Discussed the correlation between left-handed shooting and right-sided hearing loss asymmetry
Emphasized the critical need for strict hearing protection to prevent further damage
Explained the need for ENT referral due to sudden tinnitus changes and asymmetry

red_flags_present: Sudden change in tinnitus in one ear

escalation.rationale_short: To rule out retrocochlear pathology given the sudden change in tinnitus, pressure, and asymmetric hearing loss.
